org.itemscript.core
Class ItemscriptSystem

java.lang.Object
  org.itemscript.core.ItemscriptSystem
All Implemented Interfaces:
HasSystem, JsonSystem, JsonCreator, JsonGetAccess, JsonPutAccess
public final class ItemscriptSystem
extends java.lang.Object
implements JsonSystem

The implementation class for JsonSystem. In order to configure system- or platform- specific behavior, you can supply a JsonConfig object, rather than reimplementing this class.

Author:
Jacob Davies
jacob@itemscript.org

Fields inherited from interface org.itemscript.core.JsonSystem

Constructor Detail

ItemscriptSystem

public ItemscriptSystem(JsonConfig config)
Create a new JsonSystem implementation using the supplied JsonConfig. JsonConfig implementations will usually provide a static factory method for creating a new system with a config of that type; for instance, StandardConfig.createSystem().

Parameters:
config - The JsonConfig object used to set up this system.

copy

public PutResponse copy(JsonValue value,
                        java.lang.String toUrl)
Description copied from interface: JsonSystem
Copy a value into the system. The original value may come from a different JsonSystem. The value will be converted to a JSON string and then re-parsed, so JsonNative values will not be preserved and JsonString values with a binary value will be converted to base-64 encoded strings.

Specified by:
copy in interface JsonSystem
Parameters:
value - The value to copy.
toUrl - The URL to copy to.
Returns:
The PutResponse generated by the put operation.

createString

public JsonString createString(byte[] contents)
Description copied from interface: JsonCreator
Create a new JsonString with the given binary value.

Note: The JsonString object will point to the underlying byte[] that was supplied; it will not copy it. The internal operations of the JsonSystem will not change it, but it will be made directly available through the JsonString object's JsonValue.binaryValue() method. So, if you need to make sure that the original is not changed, you must copy it before supplying it to this method.

Specified by:
createString in interface JsonCreator
Parameters:
contents - The binary value of the JsonString.
Returns:
A new JsonString.

Specified by:
createString in interface JsonCreator

Returns:

Get a value from the given URL.

If the URL is relative, it will be interpreted as relative to the URL "mem:/".

public void get(java.lang.String url,
                GetCallback callback)
Description copied from interface: JsonSystem
Get a value from the given URL, asynchronously.

If the URL is relative, it will be interpreted as relative to the URL "mem:/".

Calls the given callback when the value has been retrieved.

Specified by:
get in interface JsonSystem
Parameters:
url - The URL to get the value from.
callback - Called when the value is returned.

getValue

public JsonValue getValue(java.lang.String url)
Description copied from interface: JsonGetAccess
Get a JsonValue. If the value does not exist, returns null.

This method is named "getValue" to avoid conflicts with the List and Map "get" methods. A method named "get" will be provided by any class implementing this interface, and that method should be used instead of this one, for brevity.

Specified by:
getValue in interface JsonGetAccess
Parameters:
url - The key used to find the value.
Returns:
The value, or null if the value did not exist.

parseReader

public JsonValue parseReader(java.lang.Object reader)
Description copied from interface: JsonSystem
Parse the contents of the given Reader as JSON.

The argument is specified as Object only because GWT does not contain Reader.

Note: this method is inoperative in the GWT environment.

Specified by:
parseReader in interface JsonSystem
Specified by:
parseReader in interface JsonCreator
Parameters:
reader - The Reader to parse.
Returns:
The JsonValue corresponding to the contents of the Reader.

put

public PutResponse put(java.lang.String url,
                       byte[] value)
Description copied from interface: JsonPutAccess
Put a binary value. The value will be base64-encoded and stored in a JsonString.

Note: The JsonString object will point to the underlying byte[] that was supplied; it will not copy it. The internal operations of the JsonSystem will not change it, but it will be made directly available through the JsonString object's JsonValue.binaryValue() method. So, if you need to make sure that the original is not changed, you must copy it before supplying it to this method.

Specified by:
put in interface JsonPutAccess
Parameters:
url - The URL to put the value under.
value - The binary value to store.
Returns:
The PutResponse returned by the put operation.

putValue

public PutResponse putValue(java.lang.String url,
                            JsonValue value)
Description copied from interface: JsonPutAccess
Put a JsonValue.

Note that the return from this method is the value that was returned from the put operation, which differs from the Map.put(K, V) method which returns any previous value that the map had under that url.

The put methods on JsonSystem and JsonItem are interchangeable with this method.

Specified by:
putValue in interface JsonPutAccess
Parameters:
url - The URL to put the value under.
value - The JsonValue to store.
Returns:
The PutResponse returned by the put operation.

removeValue

public RemoveResponse removeValue(java.lang.String url)
Description copied from interface: JsonPutAccess
Remove a value.

This method is named "removeValue" to avoid conflicts with the List and Map "remove" methods. A method named "remove" will be provided by any class implementing this interface, and that method should be used instead of this one, for brevity.

Parameters:

util

public JsonUtil util()
Description copied from interface: JsonSystem
Get the JsonUtil object for this system. The JsonUtil object contains various implementation methods that may be useful but aren't really part of the core system interface.

Specified by:
util in interface JsonSystem
Returns:
The associated JsonUtil.
